channel.title: 2D Skeletal Animator
channel.description:
Hello there
I'm going to be building a 2D Skeletal Animator in the near future for my game in Java. If you wish to contribute to this project please let me know through email @ justin.persinger@gmail.com Posting in this topic would also not be a bad idea
It would also be very helpful if I had an artist to create some spliced images for me for testing purposes.
Details in post #3
[quote="eyeownyew"][quote author=wildskiller link=topic=648003.msg4358751#msg4358751 date=1378238694] Explain what this "2D Skeletal Animator" is. [/quote]
It will be an animator that uses bones, timeline and interpolation
The bones will be animated on a timeline, with movement/keyframes and interpolation for the movement between the keyframes. Once the bones are animated entirely, the separate images from an animation will be loaded in (parts of a body for example) and the animations will smoothly come out and also be transferable based on the bone system
Pretty much the first 30s of this video in summary http://www.youtube.com/watch?feature=player_embedded&v=avMYAKvSqYM[/quote]

item.title: 2D Skeletal Animator
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

[quote=“Taharok, post:20, topic:529247”]This is neat. I’m actually new to the concept of using skeletal animations with 2D sprites. I’ll have to think about this some before being able to post a more intelligent reply, but I do want to encourage you to keep going with it. It’s very cool.

Who knows, maybe I’ll be interesting in implementing something like this in my game project this year. Seems fun and rather straightforward.[/quote]
I’d love to see it! If you’d like to work with me on any of it, or at least the concepts, feel free to message me anytime

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:21, topic:529247”][quote author=eyeownyew link=topic=648003.msg4358937#msg4358937 date=1378270545]

lol the amount of work… you might as well use 3d models

It wouldn’t be that much. I’ve been doing more than a hundred hours of programming per week for this so far,
[/quote]So essentially you have been programming nearly 14 hours a day, every day… christ dude[/quote]
Sounds about right. I’m not sure where my motivation came from, but it’s here

I think I’ve always had this motivation to program, actually, but I’ve never known what to program. I finally came up with a relatively unique game idea that I can consider my own and ever since I’ve been at it all day.

Read full topic

item.title: 2D Skeletal Animator
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

This is neat. I’m actually new to the concept of using skeletal animations with 2D sprites. I’ll have to think about this some before being able to post a more intelligent reply, but I do want to encourage you to keep going with it. It’s very cool.

Who knows, maybe I’ll be interesting in implementing something like this in my game project this year. Seems fun and rather straightforward.

Read full topic

item.title: 2D Skeletal Animator
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

tigerclan:

lol the amount of work… you might as well use 3d models

It wouldn’t be that much. I’ve been doing more than a hundred hours of programming per week for this so far, making this program wouldn’t take very long at that rate.

I have already spent hours exploring alternatives, also. There isn’t anything I’d be willing to substitute.

Read full topic

item.title: 2D Skeletal Animator
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:14, topic:529247”][quote author=Vain_ link=topic=648003.msg4358860#msg4358860 date=1378255489]
you’re going to be limited very fast on the possibilities of animations applied to a 2d image
[/quote]
http://pivotanimator.net/ is very popular[/quote]
Aaaaaaaaaand mine will be similar to pivot, but pivot would be the underlying bone structure. I’d just be drawing sprites on top of the bones with anchor points

Read full topic

item.title: 2D Skeletal Animator
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

Hm, no

I’m not using sprite sheets because I need to use bones as anchors for weapons/clothing/etc, and I plan on having very many animations all using the same skeletal system (multiple characters)

Animating them all separately for a sprite sheet would be a serious pain

Vain_:

so essentially you’re building a program to create sprite sheets, given the appropriate body splices?

No, they won’t be sprite sheets – they’ll be armatures with sprites attached. The implementation for my game won’t be simply drawing the image, but rather having an entire library for reading the data presented and drawing accordingly

Read full topic

item.description:
@Jaxus wrote:

This seems pretty cool, and I had no idea how a lot of games created animations, as I’ve always just used individual frames to express animation. I would like to help out, although I’m not sure how I could contribute.
